intro: Galium smithreitzii, commonly known as Smith's bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually oval or lance-shaped with serrated edges, and it has a fibrous root system. Galium smithreitzii thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
